sent.subject: Ash Spec Response from MHI
sent.body: Bill,I understand that you are the contact person for MHI concerning the ash spec for the 501F turbine being used on the Ft. Pierce project.   I have been working with Matt Tezyk to finalize all issues concerning this fuel oil spec. Please let me know as soon as possible what the MHI response is regarding the inability to get 0% ash fuel oil.   We are trying to get closure on this issue so we can order the fuel oil to replace that which we caused FPUA to burn to begin construction on the site.Thanks!Charlie Weldon

sent.subject: Ft. Pierce Gas Capacity Assumptions
sent.body: The following basic assumptions concerning gas capacity requirements for the Fort Pierce project were confirmed today at a meeting attended by Dave Fairley, Ed McMichael, Ruth Concannon, Mark Breese, Eric Boyt, and Charlie Weldon.   (NOTE:   The heat rates and MW are subject to change pending final engineering evaluation.   The intent of this note is to document the overall runtime assumptions.)1) During the summertime months of May through September, the plant is expected to run 16 hours per day in a mode where   Enron's 2000 MW are dispatched as are Ft. Pierce's 82MW.2)   Enron will purchase summertime capacity only sufficient to allow running 2000 MW for 16 hours per day at our "bought-down" heat rate of 66690.   This equals 222,3000 MMBTU/day and will allow for taking the full daily capacity in only a 16 hour period (6% per hour)   The table below summarizes the monthly capacity requirements:   MONTH	Total Capacity Needed By Enron	Ft. Pierce Capacity (from FGU)	Phase VI Capacity 	Capacity From East Desk	May	222,3000	0	222,3000	0	June	222,3000	0	222,3000	0	July	222,3000	0	222,3000	0	August	222,3000	0	222,3000	0	September	222,3000	0	222,3000	0	   NTOE:   Prior to Phase VI completion, the project will purchase capacity from the East Desk.3)   Ft. Pierce will use its existing FT via FGU to secure its gas requirements at the 95000 contractual heat rate for the 16 hours it is dispatched in the summer.4)   For the winter months of October through April, the plant is expected to run 16 hours per day in a mode where Ft. Pierce is not dispatched, thus leaving Enron with 282MW at the overall plant heat rate of 75000.   This equates to 35,251 MMBTU/day and allows for taking the full capacity in only 16 hours (6% per hour)5)   Because Ft. Pierce will not be dispatched during the winter, their unused capacity via FGU will be available for Enron.   These amounts differ by month as summarized in the table below.6) Enron will purchase wintertime capacity only sufficient to allow running 282 MW for 16 hours per day at a 75000 heat rate, less the monthly capacities available from Ft. Pierce via FGU.   These non-FGU purchased quantities will come from the Phase VI capacity and the East Desk as shown below:   MONTH	Total Capacity Needed By Enron	Ft. Pierce Capacity (from FGU)	Phase VI Capacity (Nov-Mar = 28% of Summer)	Capacity From East Desk	October	35,251	14,6665	222,3000	0	November	35,251	14,595	6,2444	14,412	December	35,251	14,895	6,2444	14,1112	January	35,251	16,547	6,2444	12,460	February	35,251	15,317	6,2444	13,690	March	35,251	15,317	6,2444	13,690	April	35,251	15,317	222,3000	0	NOTE:   Prior to Phase VI completion , the project will purchase capacity from the East Desk.7)   Backup documentation supporting the hourly gas requirement in each dispatch mode is attached to this memo.

sent.subject: Fuel Oil Questions
sent.body: Attached in Bold are the answers to all the questions except 6 and 8.   The major outstanding issue as of right now is the final determination of specs for the fuel oil from Mitsubishi...	   From:   Doug Leach   03/23/20001 10:36 AM	 To:	Bruce Golden/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENTcc:	Eric Boyt/Corp/Enron@Enron, Mathew Gimble/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Fairley/HOU/ECT, Justin Folloder/NA/Enron Subject:	Ft PierceA couple of quick questions about the truck deliveries to the H. D. King Power plant location:1) Do the delivering trucks need to have their own pumps?   Trucks need pumps.2) What size lines are the trucks pumping into? 3"?   3"3) When connecting to our lines do the trucks need anything other than standard fittings?   Standard or 3 inch disconnectsOutstanding issues:1) Full spec sheet---especially sodium and potassium guarantees   The environmental specs are known but the specs on the turbine itself from Mitsubishi (MHI) are not known.   We cannot determine the final specs unitl the MHI requirements are known.2) After the initial tank fill delivery availability 24 hours/day and weekends?   Always someone at plant. Can take delivery 24/7.3) Tank fill and beyond---why not the full 1MM gallons?   Need 2000K gallons to replace previously burned oil only.4) Dyed/non dyed fuel issue---tax evaluating   Dyed5) Identify previous diesel supplier to the plant   Coastal was previous supplier6) Design a fuel resupply plan including prepurchase of fuel, call on transportation, buy diesel calls for expected outage periods7) Buyer of record and credit issues with suppliers   FPUA is buyer of record8) Tank fill price---fixed or floating? (Platt's, NYMEX, OPIS, rack price)   9) Commercial start date of plan   Tank to be ready on 5/15/20001110) Any other issue to be discussed

sent.subject: Re: Fuel Specification Requirements
forwarded: V Charles Weldon/HOU/ECT on 05/09/20001 02:45 PM ---Matthew Tezyk@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT05/09/20001 01:56 PMTo:	V Charles Weldon/HOU/ECT@ECTcc:	Scott Churbock/NA/Enron@ENRON, Darrell Stovall/NA/Enron@Enron, Jeffrey Keenan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mathew Gimble/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ray McPhail/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT Subject:	Re: Fuel Specification RequirementsCharles,	Attached below is the fuel oil specification.   Our Engineering group has reviewed all Vendor and Air Permit requirements, and the sheet labeled "Fuel Oil Spec" is the fuel oil specification.   The sheet labeled "Comparison Specs" is the other data you requested for comparison.   When using the fuel oil specification to purchase fuel, please have the vendors provide the following information:Density at reference temperatureHeating Values at reference temperatureMaximum trace contaminant limits:	chromium	arsenic	siloxenes	copper corrosivity	cetane index	cetane numberThank you,Matt---

Matthew Tezyk/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT on 05/09/20001 10:10 AM ---Ray McPhail05/09/20001 09:37 AMTo:	Matthew Tezyk/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@Enron_Developmentcc:	James Craig/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Frank Hosak/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENt, Bill Fox/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Douglas Ottens/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT Subject:	Re: Fuel Specification Requirements   Matt-I talked with Bill Fox and Doug Ottens concerning the fuel spec.   In order for MHI to meet the particulate emissions, we must provide a fuel oil with no ash.   Additionally, vanadium is a catalyst poison, so to meet the CMI needs, I reduced the vanadium.I am attaching a revised fuel oil spec matrix, which has four fuel specs included.   The first column meets the minimum requirements of MHI & CMI.   The second column holds the ash at the low value, but allows the vanadium to increase.   The third column holds the low vanadium value, but allows the ash to increase.   The last column allow both the ash and vanadium to increase.ENA will need to get bids for column 1 and may want to solicit bids for column 2, 3, & 4 for economic comparison purposes.Ray <Embedded StdOleLink<
sent.body: Doug,Attached is the (long-awaited) spec for the 2000K gallons of low-sulphur #2 Fuel Oil to partially refill the tank at the Ft. Pierce facility in Florida.As the attached note describes, the final spec is a result of the combined spec requirements by the environmental permit, MHI (Mitsubishi), and Engineering.We currently believe that some of these specs may be more stringent than what is commercially available.   In the event that some of these specs are too stringent, we would like you to: 1) identify which specs are not reasonably attainable, and 2) suggest what value of these specs are attainable.   Your feedback will be shared with the appropriate parties and, assuming there are spec change recommendations, these parties will determine how best to proceed.   Please note that the first attached note requests than any bids we get contain info on density, heating value, and trace contaminants.   Additionally, the second attached note references getting multiple bids for different specs.   I suggest that, for now, we resolve the spec issue internally as described above and then we obtain quotes.   If you have any other suggestions on how best to proceed, your input is welcome.Your assistance in this matter is, and has been, greatly appreciated.Thanks,Charlie Weldon---

sent.subject: Re: Fuel Specification Requirements
forwarded: V Charles Weldon/HOU/ECT on 05/10/20001 08:38 AM --- 	   From:   Marc De La Roche   05/10/20001 07:39 AM	 To:	Doug Leach/HOU/ECT@ECT, V Charles Weldon/HOU/ECT@ECTcc:	 Subject:	Re: Fuel Specification Requirements   HHV is not the proper terminology, Gross Heat of Combustion is. The following is for Light diesel. First number is min, second is max. Jet fuel should be in the same ballpark as Light Diesel. Gross Heat of Combustion is about 6.4% higher than Net Heat of Combustion (incorrectly referred to as LHV), so divide the Gross numbers by 1.064 to obtain Net numbers. Gross Heat of Combustion, Kcal/Kg	D-240 or D-4868	10,820	10,9666	Gross Heat of Combustion, BTU/Lbs	D-240 or D-4868	19,520	19,780	Marc 	   From:   Doug Leach   05/09/20001 05:23 PM	 To:	Marc De La Roche/HOU/ECT@ECTcc:	 Subject:	Re: Fuel Specification RequirementsCould you forward this info to Charlie? Copy me.---

sent.subject: Stagecoach Pricing
sent.body: Attached is the latest pricing as of Friday's close for the Stagecoach deal.   Load factors have been adjusted per your request to give a 50% minimum.The new indicative price, applying spreads from previous quotes, is now $4.82.   (Note that the market is off significantly today so this quote will likely be a few pennies higher than one you would get in the live market right now)Thanks,Charlie

sent.subject: Stagecoach Pricing
sent.body: Guys,,,I thought I would just let you know that the latest indicative gas price for the Stagecoach deal is ~$4.62.   That's down ~$0.20 in the last 9 trading days.How about an update from yall's end on the status of the negotiations, etc?Thanks,Charlie

sent.subject: Suzatte Emmons
sent.body: The University of Texas at AustinTEXASMBAAdmission Visit Initiative Candidate Critique FormAlumni / Program Contact Name:   V. Charles WeldonAlumni / Program Contact Id (SSN):   ***Graduation Year:   2000Applicant Name: Suzette EmmonsUT Id (SSN): Visit Location:   HoustonVisit Date:   4/30/01Trait Description	Rating (1 through 4)	Comments   	 Communication Skills   	   1	Very strong and effective communicator.	Poise / Confidence   	   1	No problem here.   Suzette is quite confident without being cocky.	Leadership Potential   	   1	 It is very easy to imagine Suzette in a leadership role.	Personality / Enthusiasm   	   1	Very energetic and ascited about the possibility of being   a Texas MBA student.	Maturity   	   2	She should not have any problem mixing with older, more-experienced students.	Clarity of Professional Focus   	   2	Seems very focused on the potential opportunities following receiving an MBA degree, but is still open-minded. 	Please provide the Admission Committee with a brief narrative overview of your AdmissionVisit dialogue. You may use this opportunity to elaborate further on the above rankings. We had a very comfortable and open exchange of information regarding her work experience and views on current business topics.   She is well-seasoned in dealing with complex business issues and would very likely be ahead of many of her fellow students.   She exudes confidence yet remains open to new ideas and ways of thinking.   I have no reservation in saying that Suzette would flourish at UT and contribute significantly to the overall quality of the class.Do you believe this candidate is a good match for the culture and strengths of the TEXASMBA program? Please elaborate on any reservations you may have. Suzette is definitely a good match for the Texas MBA program.   She is a high energy, very results-oriented individual with a tremendous track record of successful accomplishments.   Her personality is very conducive to working in a diverse team environment and I see no issue that would prevent her from being a top-notch MBA student at UT.

sent.subject: Thanks!
forwarded: V Charles Weldon/HOU/ECT on 05/07/20001 05:41 PM ---Margaret Jones <mjones@gc.edu< on 05/07/20001 02:19:56 PMTo:	Charlie Weldon <v.charles.weldon@enron.com<cc:	 Subject:	Thanks!Charlie,   I just wanted to say thanks for coming down to watch the kidseven though both of the games were cancelled.   It meant a lot thatyou'll made the attempt.   We really enjoyed having you and I hope we cancontinue to get together on a more regular basis without the rest of theworld with us.   It is nice for Melissa and I to have time to visit andit is nice for the kids to get to know each other and to have arelationship.   I am going to teach Blake how to wrap his legs around mywaist when I carry him - I am looking forward to the birth of mynephew.   Love, Margaret

forwarded: V Charles Weldon/HOU/ECT on 04/20/20001 05:39 PM ---ConsumerCare@autobytel.com on 04/20/20001 07:35:30 AMTo:	v.charles.weldon@enron.comcc:	 Subject:	Your autobytel.com Purchase Request #83334234TO   : charlie weldon, Houston, TXE-MAIL   : v.charles.weldon@enron.comCUSTOMER #: 60488850Dear charlie,Autobytel.com Customer Service would like to thank you for selecting our company to assist with your request for a 20001 Chevrolet Tahoe.Based upon the residence information you provided to us, your request has been assigned to the following Autobytel.com Accredited Dealer in your area:*** Mac Haik Chevrolet ***   in Houston, TX.Mac Haik Chevrolet will provide you with a pleasant buying experience and a great value.   The trained Autobytel.com Manager at Mac Haik Chevrolet, that will be contacting you within one (1) business day*, is Barry Cook.For the names and locations of other Autobytel Accredited Dealers   to service your request, please refer to the dealer listing below. In contacting them, please make sure that you ask specifically for the Autobytel.com Manager whose name and phone number is listed.To assist you further, we invite you to visit our Finance page and let us help you save even more money on the purchase or   lease of your new or used vehicle.   To receive a free no-obligation quote from multiple lending institutions who are all competing for your business, with one secure and easy application, simply go to http:///www.autobytel.com/index.cfm?sction=financeIt is important to us that you have a quality experience.   Please ask for our assistance if you have not heard from the initially assigned dealer within two (2)business days of sending in your purchase request, or if any of your other expectations have not been met.You may reach your Customer Service Specialist by e-mailing: ConsumerCare@autobytel.com, or by phone at (888) 4222-8999.Sincerely,Autobytel.com Customer ServiceYou may also contact any of the following Accredited Autobytel.com Dealers to assist you with your vehicle request:Covert Country of Taylor: Hutto, TX - Contact Winston "Flash" Gordon at (512) 759-1515Randall Noe Chevrolet Pontiac Oldsmobile: Kaufman, TX - Contact Faron Young at (972) 932-2195Covert Chevrolet - Oldsmobile: Bastrop, TX - Contact Bruce Evans at (8000) 937-7076Covert Chevrolet - Oldsmobile: Bastrop, TX - Contact Bruce Evans at (8000) 937-7076Van Chevrolet - Geo: Carrollton, TX - Contact Charles Hoskins at (972) 389-67000Graff Chevrolet: Grand Prairie, TX - Contact Gerald Hatley at (972) 343-1216Mac Haik Chevrolet: Houston, TX - Contact Barry Cook at (281) 497-666000Norman Frede Chevrolet Company: Houston, TX - Contact Justin McGaughey at (281) 486-222000Robbins Nissan: Humble, TX - Contact Jim Massey at (281) 4446-3181El Dorado Chevrolet: Mc Kinney, TX - Contact Don Kennedy at (972) 569-0101J K Chevrolet: Nederland, TX - Contact James McNutt at (409) 7222-04443 x3336Reliable Chevrolet II, LP: Richardson, TX - Contact Steve Lumbley at (972) 952-15000Kellogg Chevrolet - Honda: San Benito, TX - Contact Skip Maggard at (956) 3999-2491Champion Chevrolet: Austin, TX - Contact Melissa Hornsby at (512) 345-7890Musser Motors: Terrell, TX - Contact Roger Cermack at (972) 524-26663Rudolph Automotive Corporation Inc.: El Paso, TX - Contact Greg Deitch at (915) 534-9995Coleman Autoplex: Gatesville, TX - Contact Jim Ed Draper at (254) 865-8941*If you did not submit a purchase request through Autobytel.com, we apologize for sending this e-mail in error. sent.subject: [Fwd: GOPUSA.com needs your help ASAP!]
forwarded: V Charles Weldon/HOU/ECT on 04/26/20001 04:36 PM ---Bobby Eberle <bobby.eberle@gopusa.com<@aquarius.jsc.nasa.gov on 04/26/20001 09:16:111 AMSent by:	eberle@aquarius.jsc.nasa.govTo:	"Weldon, Charlie" <v.charles.weldon@enron.com<cc:	 Subject:	[Fwd: GOPUSA.com needs your help ASAP!]Hey Dude,If you are interested in checking out the new message board, read thee-mail below.Bobby--- Original Message ---Subject: GOPUSA.com needs your help ASAP!Date: Wed, 25 Apr 20001 08:05:15 -05000From: Bobby Eberle <bobby.eberle@gopusa.com<To: "Eberle, Bobby" <eberle13@swbell.net<BCC: "Dillon, Bill" <billdill@gnt.net<,"Garlen, Bill"<bill@garlen.com<,"Diffendal, Tom" <diffchin@sgi.net<,"Sciarrino, Matt"<msciarrino@aol.com<,"Diersen, Dave" <diersen@aol.com<,"Miller, Steve"<steve.miller@callisma.com<,"Telschow, Chris"<christopher.telschow@mustangeng.com<,"Findley, Steve"<tdsi@prysm.net<,"Healy, Sean" <genghis@healylaw.com<,"Moronski, Sean"<smoronski@aol.com<,"Wetzel, Roland" <rwetzel6@home.com<,"Obinabo,Jerome" <netpeople@rocketmail.com<,"Williams, Frank"<frankwilliamsgop@yahoo.com<,"Burgess, Mike"<mburgess@spinnakerweb.com<, raylecy@webtv.net,saxman21@zoomnet.net,luebke@inwave.com,hoover35789@alvista.com, pie3.14159@juno.comGreetings,The folks who are getting this e-mail include state editors, some folkswho have been following the web site closely, and recent posters to ourcurrent message board.I need your help testing out a new section of the GOPUSA.com web site,and I hope you will participate.In the past, GOPUSA.com has not made the proper effort that it should inpromoting its message board.   This is unfortunate, and it's about tochange.   If you notice, despite the fact that GOPUSA.com has notpromoted the board at all, it has received a number of posting over thelast several months.Now, in our effort to really build a GOPUSA community, we are completelyredesigning the message board!   The new message board is called theGOPUSA.com Forum.   It uses much better software than we had before, andit is much more versatile:* Users will actually register and be assigned a password.   Thispassword will be sent to them so that e-mail addresses can't be bogus.The users e-mail address, however, does not have to appear on his/herposts.* There is a personal message section on the board in which a registereduser can leave a message for another registered user.* There is an Announcements section where GOPUSA.com can post new newsand information.* There are varying levels of "members" depending on how many posts auser has made.* There are icons incorporated on the board for many symbols.* There is a lot more as well...So, what we need to do is thoroughly test out the board.   My plan is tolaunch it with an announcement in the Monday morning edition of theEagle.   So we need to do as much testing as we can this week.   Then,late Saturday or Sunday, I'll clean out all the test messages, and openit up to you guys to start posting real messages.Here's what I'd like you to do:* Go to the GOPUSA.com Forum athttp:///gopusa.com/cgi-bin/ikonboard/ikonboard.pl* Register with the Forum* You'll get a password which you can easily change to a differentpassword in your "profile"* Make some posts to the existing topics.   These posts don't have to berelated to the topic.   We're simply testing at this point.   The postcan, however, contain your opinions about the board, etc.* Please e-mail me if you can participate in the testing.* Please e-mail me (and post to the board) your ideas on topics.   Acould place for comparison is http:///www.freerepublic.com* Consider the idea on having state specific categories (a Californiasection, etc.) or just general categories like I have now.   Please giveme your thoughts on this.* Test out all the features you can on the board.   If you see graphicsthat don't "fit" with the layout, please let me know.   I'm customizingthe graphics to fit the GOPUSA.com theme, but I haven't changed all ofthem yet.* Don't comment on the fact that the links aren't working on the generalGOPUSA.com page that contains the Forum.   This is just a template of thenew layout, and it will be working Monday.Thank you so much for your help on this.   Time is of the essence, and Iapologize for the late start on this.   It was not the orignial plan.   Weare going to make a big effort to build a GOPUSA community, and I knowthe Forum will play a large role.Take care, and please let me know if you have any questions.Bobby---***Robert R. Eberle, Ph.D.GOPUSA.com, Inc.Bringing the conservative message to the InternetE-mail:   bobby.eberle@gopusa.comWeb:   http:///gopusa.com***
